Comment: I did read the docs and this is not the conclusion I came to.   I saw a local PD interview record, a DHS record of his detention, a record of his appeal for bond after the IJ denied it (this appeal was dismissed), and the original IJ decision denying him bond.   That last thing is what people are using to defend the indefensible (deporting illegal immigrants to indefinite arbitrary detention), under the claim that "courts ruled" Garcia was a member of MS-13. This is incorrect. The IJ determined that Garcia should be denied bond because of the "evidence,"  provided  by the DHS  (i.e their suspicion), that Garcia was a verified member of MS-13. This was not a habeas proceeding, but a bond hearing. There's nothing about the deportation stay Garcia sought due to being in fear of returning to El Salvador. I don't even think deportation was addressed in these docs.  Side note: interesting discrepancy on the DHS form.  One part said Garcia caimed to be in fear of returning to El Salvador, while another part says he denied being in feared.
